oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FINE-SCALE MEASUREMENT OF SEDIMENT SUSPENSION BY BREAKING WAVES AT SUPERTANK
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Barkaszi, Stephen F.
Dally, William R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: suspended sediment
SUPERTANK
breaking waves
fine scale measurement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the SUPERTANK data collection project, a mobile, vertical array of five Optical Backscatterance Sensors was used to measure sand suspension in the outer surf zone. Test conditions included both regular and random waves, and two different wave energy levels. Examination of the data reveals significant cross-shore variation in both the structure of the time-dependent concentration, as well as mean suspended load.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
